• Trade entrance exam: 100 questions, 3 hours, pass mark 70%.
• PPE: hard hats, eye protection, correct use for the task.
• Exam strategy: do easy questions first; note progress per hour.
• Fire classes: Class A (ordinary combustibles), B (flammables), C (electrical), D (metals).

• Area of a circle = πr². Circumference = πD. Volume of a cylinder = πr²h.
• Gas expands when heated; water boils at 100°C at sea level.
• Density = mass/volume (e.g. g/cm³). A liter of water has a mass of 1 kg.

• Intermediate welding techniques and safety.
• Gas welding: oxygen is green, acetylene is red.
• Basic fabrication measurements and layout.
• Portable welding equipment setup and operation.

• For offsets: Travel = Set × multiplier. Common multipliers: 45° = 1.414, 30° = 1.155, 60° = 2.000.
• Intermediate metric ↔ imperial conversions.
• Simple geometry for pipe layouts.

• Confined space entry procedures and permits.
• Atmospheric testing requirements.
• Advanced hazard assessment techniques.
• Emergency response planning for industrial settings.

• Simple rolling offsets and compound calculations.
• Intermediate trigonometry for pipe fitting.
• Advanced layout calculations for pipe systems.
• Load calculations for basic rigging.

• Advanced hazard and risk assessment methodologies.
• Environmental compliance and regulations.
• Emergency response procedures and management.
• Journeyman-level safety responsibilities and authority.

• Full isometric, orthographic, and P&ID reading.
• Fabrication-level interpretation and analysis.
• System selection fundamentals and applications.
• Advanced valve and component specification reading.
